text: hi everyone its Elise from my epic
addiction on today's episode I'm going
to be showing you how to make these
super cute little cupcake burgers we're
also going to be making some cupcake
fries I love food disguised as other
food and I've done a ton of videos on
various foods disguised as other foods
so make sure you check out my cupcakes
in disguise playlist if you want to see
more of these let's get started
the things that you'll need for today's
tutorial we've got some rice krispies or
rice bubbles some milk some butter a
little bit of sugar I'm using a serrated
circle cutter but a regular circle
cutter would do a fondant rolling pin
some scissors a few spoons I've got some
melted dark chocolate some melted green
candy melts a couple of eggs some corn
flake I've got some red frosting and
some yellow frosting I've got some
sesame seeds and I'm just using a packet
mix today I've got an ice cream scoop
and a couple of Ziploc bags of course I
also have an electric mixer with a whisk
attachment off to the side I've got a
couple of sheets of baking paper or
grease proof paper I've also got a
little template that I've made out for
you guys for our little fries container
this is the most adorable thing in the
world so all you need to do is cut
around that Frye's container fold on the
little lines there and tape it at the
sides and you've got yourself a little
tiny Frye's container and I've also got
a cupcake tray you'll also need a little
bit of nonstick spray now the first
thing that you want to do is you want to
take your cake mix and just make it up
I'm making mine as per the manufacturers
directions
all right so once your mix has finished
mixing you want to take your sprain out
and you just want to give your cupcake
tray a really generous spray the reason
we want to give it a really generous
phrase because we're not actually using
cupcake liners and you don't want your
cupcakes to stick here all right now
using your ice cream scoop you just want
to divide that batter into your little
muffin cup holes or cupcake cup holes
straight in there no cupcake liners
perfect now before those go off into the
oven we're just gonna give them a
sprinkle with our little sesame seeds
now I know some of you will be concerned
about the flavor of sesame seeds but the
truth is sesame seeds actually don't
taste like anything if you put them on
something savory they pick up the savory
taste if you put them on something sweet
they pick up the sweet taste and they
really give us that impression of a
proper little hamburger bun you only
want to put your sesame seeds on 9 out
of your 12 and not on the remaining
three because those remaining three are
actually going to be our fries pop those
buns off into the oven so you'll know
they're cooked when they spring back in
the middle all right so while your
burgers are cooking its giving us some
time to prepare our meat patties and
also our lettuce so it's as simple as
taking your dark chocolate and your Rice
Krispies and we'll just scoop that in
there and stir it all around I've also
got my wax paper handy for this so you
can see there I've sort of folded it in
half we want to sandwich our Rice
Krispies in between these two halves so
just spooning out your delicious
chocolatey rice bubbly mix and kind of
just spread it out using the back of
your spoon a little bit now sandwich
your baking paper over and then just use
your hands just to start pushing down
I'm just going to roll it out you don't
want these to be too thick because you
want to bear in mind they're going to go
in the center of your cupcake if they're
too thick the cupcakes are not going to
be easy to eat all right so to have a
quick look at that you can see that it's
really not very thick we're not going to
end up with a very thick rice krispies
treat once we cut those in half that can
go off into the fridge to set and then
you want to do the same thing with your
cornflakes and your melted green candy
melts this is going to make a delicious
best part about these burgers great for
vegetarians all right once you're happy
that you can't see any more of those
yellow corn flakes just scoop it out
again onto that baking paper and just
use your spoon just to kind of separate
it out a bit that's gonna help it dry
and that's gonna go off into the fridge
just on a tray or some
as well so when your cereals come out of
the fridge you just want to take your
little bits of lettuce and just break
them up with your hand or you can use a
knife just to kind of roughly chop them
and pop them in a bowl peel open your
little Rice Krispies and they should
feel nice and set and you just wanna
take your cookie cutter these actually
cut really easily but you just want to
push in with quite a bit of pressure
lift up your little circle and then just
use your fingers to pop it out those are
going to be your meat patties and you
can see they're half thin they are so
you do really want it to be nice and
thin to make them easy for your guests
to eat you can now prepare your source
and your cheese so it's going to be as
simple as just taking that yellow and
red frosting and just scooping it into
your ziplock bags make sure you push
that all the way down to the corner and
let any air out before you seal the bag
off and then we're just gonna snip a
nice chunky corner off the end so I'm
quite a thick and chunky corner there
repeat that with the yellow so coming
back from the oven and we've got our
little cupcakes here with the little

and then I've got my little ones without
so the first thing we're going to do is
we're going to decorate the ones without
to look like french fries I was
originally going to use this really cool
little wave vegetable cutter tool but I
found it actually squished my cupcakes
because they're too soft and moist and
fluffy so I'm just going to use a
serrated edge knife and I'm just going
to cut my cupcake into three don't worry
about any little brown edges they're
actually going to make your french fries
or your chips look more realistic and
then just sort of trim off the edges so
that you're working with nice little
flat edges for your chips and then you
want to cut each of those into about
three pieces now take your little French
fries or chips as we call them in
Australia and just roll them in that
sugar that's going to make them look
like they're salted perfect so now
you're just want to take you a little
french fries packet and you can print
those off I will leave a link in the
description box below but you just want
to just fill it with your little french
fries and make sure they're all
different heights and you've got a
little bit of the brown edges facing
forward and a little bit of the white
edges facing forward so they look kind
of textured like normal chips beautiful
there's your little french fries ready
to be plated up and then moving on to
our beautiful burgers so with your
burgers you want to cut them about where
this line is so you kind of want a
bigger base than you do with the top
because the tops really just the top of
our hamburger bun lovely now I like to
start with the cheese
on the bottom layer everything that we
stick on here has to be able to stick
something else to it because if you end
up putting say a meat patty straight
onto your cupcake it's going to have
nothing to stick to and it's going to
come apart when people try to eat so
sticking to that cheese on goes our meat
patty and then a little bit of tomato
sauce and then on to that tomato sauce
some of our nice little bits of green
lettuce the green lettuce doesn't have
to go all the way into the center but so
long as it's kind of poking out the
edges you'll get that lettuce the effect
perfect now because otherwise our tops
can have nothing to stick to I'm just
going to stick to us another dollop of
that red frosting right in the center
because I don't really want that poking
out the sides and then on goes our
little top there you've got your
gorgeous little burger cupcake you can
also go a little bit further here and
you can add a little bit of tomato sauce
to your french fries by just drizzling
some of that red frosting over I
absolutely love these little burgers I
love food disguised as other food and I
think these are one of my absolute
favorite cupcakes I hope you guys have
enjoyed this tutorial as always thanks
very much for tuning in
